Palm Tree Club Miami 1819 79th Street Causeway North Bay Village, FL 33141 Hotel Phone: 305-865-7100 Front Desk Inquiries: reception@palmtreeclubmiami.com Reservations: r eservations@palmtreeclubmiami.com Restaurant Phone: 786-204-1366 Email: dining@palmtreeclubmiami.com Marina Email: boats@palmtreeclubmiami.com Radio Channel: #71 Live Events Email: VIP@palmtreeclubmiami.com Thank you for reaching out! We will be in touch shortly. First Name * Last Name * Email Address * Comments Privacy Policy agreement I have read and agree to the Privacy Policy . Yes, I would like to receive emails with exclusive specials and offers. Submit FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS Live Music & Events What time does the live music start? Doors open at 3 PM. Is there a cover charge for guests to enjoy the live music? Only for ticketed events. Get your tickets on Posh: https://posh.vip/g/ptc-miami . Do I need a reservation to see the live music? Not unless it's a ticketed event. How long does the live music performance last? Sunset parties typically go until 12 AM. Is the music indoors or outdoors? Both. Do you have a schedule or calendar for upcoming live music performances? Yes! Be sure to check our socials and website for more details: www.palmtreeclubmiami.com . Do you offer special deals or promotions? For offers and experiences, check our OpenTable: Palm Tree Club Miami Restaurant - North Bay Village, FL | OpenTable . Are there specific days or nights dedicated to live music? Typically Saturdays and Sundays, but please check our website for more details! What time will the DJs perform at the events we've published? Stay tuned to our social media for updates on set times. What’s the dress code for events? Come as you are—sneakers, flip-flops, heels, sequins, or bikini tops. Feel free to wear jeans, shorts, or even your suit (but we hope you lose the tie). Hotel General Information Is there a minimum age to check in? Yes, guests must be 21 years or older to check-in and will be required to present a valid photo ID, in addition to their method of payment. What time is check-in and check-out? Check-in time: 4pm Check-out time: 11am Can I check in early or check out late? Early check-in or late check-out may be available upon request, subject to availability. Please contact the front desk for more information. How late can I check-in? Our front desk is available 24 hours. What is required to check-in? Guests must be 21 years or older to check in and will be required to present a valid photo ID in addition to their method of payment. Is parking available at the hotel? Yes, complimentary on-site parking is available for all hotel guests. Can I store my luggage before or after I check out? Yes, complimentary luggage storage is available at our Front Desk. Is the hotel accessible for guests with disabilities? Yes, we have accessible rooms, ramps, and elevators for your convenience. Please inform us of any specific needs prior to your arrival. Are there any extra charges or resort fees? $20 plus taxes Resort Fee is applied to all reservations. Is the hotel pet-friendly? Yes. A non-refundable $100 pet fee applies. Room and Facilities Do the rooms include complimentary Wi-Fi? Yes, free Wi-Fi is available in all rooms and public areas of the hotel. When will my room be cleaned, and how do I request additional items? Your room will receive full cleaning service every third day of your stay. For any requests, such as extra towels or amenity refills, please contact the Front Desk at any time. Are there any amenities in the rooms? Our rooms come with air conditioning, a flat-screen TV, minibar, safe, Bluetooth speaker, hair dryer, and ironing board. Check the room description for specific details. Do you have accessible rooms? We offer three accessible room types - our Accessible Classic King and Accessible Classic Double, Accessible Deluxe King. For more specifics, check out our Accessibility page. Is there a smoking policy in the hotel? Our hotel is smoke-free, and smoking is only allowed in designated areas. Please ensure compliance with our smoking policy. A $250 cleaning fee will be applied if any odor is found in the room. Do you offer breakfast? Brunch begins at 11am. Do you have a restaurant or bar on-site? Yes, we have Palm Tree Club Miami Restaurant. Open daily, our restaurant serves up coastal-American food in a casual dining environment, with all your favorites & Miami’s best sunset views! Do you offer laundry and dry cleaning services? Yes, laundry and dry cleaning services are available. Booking and Payments Does the hotel accept traveler’s checks as payment? No, we do not accept traveler’s checks as payment. Does the hotel require any deposit at check in? Yes, at check-in, we require a $150 incidental deposit per stay, in addition to the room and tax charges. This is just a hold on the credit card. If the guest doesn’t incur any incidentals or make any purchases during their stay, the hold will be released within 5 to 7 business days after check-out. Does the hotel require any deposit prior to checking in? Pre-stay deposits are dependent upon the rate plan reserved. What type of credit cards are accepted at the hotel? MasterCard, Visa, American Express, and Discover are all accepted. What is your cancellation policy? Cancellation policy depends on the reservation rate booked. We offer rates with a refundable reservation up to 72 hours before arrival, as well as discounted non-refundable rates. Can I book directly on your website? Yes, we recommend booking directly through our website for the best rates and special offers. Can I modify or cancel my reservation after booking? Cancellation/Modification policy depends on the reservation rate booked. We offer rates that may be cancelled or modified up to 72 hours before arrival, as well as discounted non-refundable rates that do not allow cancellations or modifications. Special Requests and Policies Can I send a package to the hotel? Yes, we’re happy to accept packages prior to your arrival. Please be sure that the name of the registered guest is included in the delivery information and be sure to use our Security/Receiving address: 1819 79th Street Causeway North Bay Village, FL 33141 Can I request special accommodations or amenities (e.g., flowers, champagne, etc.)? Yes, we can arrange special requests for a fee. Please contact us ahead of time to ensure availability. Do you offer shuttle service to the airport? We do not offer this service directly, however, our concierge services may assist in making a shuttle reservation with a 3rd party company. Additional Services Can I book tours or activities through the hotel? Yes, we’d be happy to assist with booking. Please stop by the front desk to inquire about available options. Our concierge team can also help with making reservations. Do you have a gym or fitness center? Yes, we have a brand-new fitness center, and it’s open 24 hours a day for your convenience! Reservations & Ticketing How can I contact the restaurant if I have further questions? You can reach us at 786-204-1366 or email us at dining@palmtreeclubmiami.com . Will there be commissions for promoters who refer clients? For more information, email VIP@palmtreeclubmiami.com . Contact Information How can I contact the hotel if I have further questions? You can reach us at 305-865-7100 or email us at reception@palmtreeclubmiami.com . Our team is available 24/7 to assist you. Join the Crew Thank you for your interest. Artman Agency 2016-08-05T14:13:00Z Share Facebook Email X LinkedIn Reddit Bluesky WhatsApp Copy link lighning bolt icon An icon in the shape of a lightning bolt. Impact Link Save Saved Read in app Add us on This story is available exclusively to Business Insider
                subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? Log in . Today, Nikki Beach is famous for its luxurious ambience, lavish beach parties, and celebrity clientele. But before the beach club's founder Jack Penrod became a successful entrepreneur, he was flipping burgers as a McDonald's line cook. Using clever marketing tactics, Penrod worked his way up the ranks of McDonald's before eventually leaving to start his own luxury brand. He became famous in the '80s for opening up Penrod's Beach Club, reviving Miami Beach and turning it into a trendy spot for young travelers and spring breakers. In 1998, Penrod introduced the first Nikki Beach club, combining music and dining with fashion, film, and art. Today, Nikki Beach has expanded to include its beach clubs, hotels, a charity, and even an entire lifestyle division. We spoke to Penrod to learn about his fascinating rise to success, from the difficulties he faced to his triumphs. Nikki Beach is famous for its themed parties, international cuisine, all-white decor, and the top DJs it draws in. The beach clubs were created to honor and celebrate the life of Penrod's daughter Nicole, who passed away in a car crash at the age of 18. The company fulfills its philosophy of "Celebrate Life!" through its many events. Facebook/Nikki Beach Saint Tropez Penrod began working at the age of 9, doing everything from carrying newspapers to cleaning bakery pans to get by. In 1961, he was working at the Greenbrier Hotel in West Virginia when he heard about a new chain — McDonald's — opening up. He thought the idea had a lot of promise, so he left and went to Tallahassee, Florida, to start working as a line cook for 85 cents an hour. Nikki Beach Thanks to his enthusiasm, he was promoted to manager within a few days. Penrod, who was 21 at the time, asked his boss if he could get a share of the gross profit if he was able to make their location the most successful McDonald's of its time. His boss said yes, so he started using some interesting marketing tactics: creating free lunches for schools, delivering burgers to Miss Florida parties, and starting a birthday club at McDonald's. Justin Sullivan/Getty Images Through these tactics, Penrod took his restaurant's yearly profit from $90,000 a year to $440,000 a year. Eventually, Penrod went on to acquire 16 different South Florida McDonald's within seven years. He left the company in 1975, after being offered the chance to buy out at a value of roughly $10 million. Artman Agency In the early '80s, he shifted his efforts to entertainment, opening Penrod's Beach Club in Fort Lauderdale. Penrod's became famous for the thousands of spring breakers it drew in. Penrod would send buses to over 120 colleges, bringing in an average of 2,000 people a day during spring break. In 1984, the mayor of Miami Beach contacted Penrod to see if he could help revive Miami Beach, which in the years prior had earned a reputation for being packed with retirees. Nikki Beach Pernod was given a 40-year lease on beachfront property, and he opened a second Penrod's at One Ocean Drive in Miami Beach. "I knew I had to do something to catch the world's attention," Penrod said. He started hosting events like Beach Boys concerts, and he even brought in an Olympic skier to ride down a giant mound of ice piled on the beach. Nikki Beach In 1977, Penrod replaced the club's pool with a garden, calling it Café Nikki in honor of his daughter. The space became very popular, drawing in celebrities like Bruce Willis, Michael Douglas, and Madonna. Penrod continued to develop the beachfront property until he eventually opened the first Nikki Beach location there in 1998. Nikki Beach Penrod had studied beach clubs in Europe and knew he wanted to create a luxury brand. So instead of using rusty umbrellas and lounge chairs, he spent around $1 million on each property's furniture, bringing in vintage wooden farm tables that were heavy enough for people to dance on, and director's chairs so that their guests could sit comfortably for hours. Nikki Beach They also made the company's logo a tipi, since Penrod, an avid pilot and hiker, always felt close with nature. It was also a symbol that could easily be identified around the world. "Our goal was to create a high-end global brand, so that when people see our tipi, they can know to expect five-star service and our casual atmosphere," Penrod said. Artman Agency For Penrod, the goal wasn't to open a nightclub, but to have a space where people could dine, relax, and enjoy partying. His mentality was that as people grow older, they don't want to be out partying until 3 or 4 in the morning. With the concept of a beach club, they could come in, enjoy the party scene, and still get to bed at a practical time. Facebook/Nikki Beach Marbella "We would dream up reasons to throw parties," Penrod said. Across their properties, Nikki Beach's themed parties include everything from circus celebrations to jungle parties. The beach clubs are also notorious for their white party, an idea they conceived when Naomi Campbell hosted a white clothing-themed birthday party there years ago. Facebook/Nikki Beach Mallorca Eventually, they became so busy at their Miami Beach location that customers suggested they open another, which they did in 2002 in Saint-Tropez, France. They chose St. Barts and Marbella for future Nikki Beach locations. Nikki Beach While each location has its own unique elements, there are some features that remain constant throughout. These include the furniture and the staff uniform: white flowing palazzo pants and hand-carved leather utility belts from Nicaragua, which Penrod told us they wear because it's the ideal size for holding bottle openers. Nikki Beach About 50% of the menu stays the same in each location, while the rest is adapted to the local taste of the region. Menu items include a raw bar, sushi, fresh salads, hearty sandwiches, fresh seafood plates, and pastas. Nikki Beach also hosts its famous Sunday Brunch, when its culinary team creates rotisserie stations, a rolling sushi station, and an extensive dessert display. Facebook/Nikki Beach Marbella They also host celebrities, producers, and VIPs both at its beach clubs and at pop-up locations they create for major events like the Cannes Film Festival and the Toronto International Film Festival. Some of Nikki Beach's celebrity clients include Woody Allen, Al Pacino, Jay Z, Kanye West, Justin Timberlake, Scarlet Johansson, and Ryan Gosling, among many others. Nikki Beach For Penrod, part of the success has come from the work habits he has developed over the years, as he worked seven years from open to close while at McDonald's, and he never took a day off. Facebook/Nikki Beach Miami He also told us it's also about ensuring you hire great people and take good care of them. When they opened a Nikki Beach location in Koh Samui, Thailand, in 2009, there wasn't much of a hospitality industry on the island. They hired 100 people, none of whom spoke English or had even seen a knife or fork, and worked with them so they could learn the necessary skills. They still have the same employees working for them today. Nikki Beach In 2007, Penrod decided to expand into the hotel industry with Nikki Beach Hotels & Resorts. "I was thinking about what I could do for my family because with the clubs, you really have to be on your toes, but I used to be in the hotel business so I thought it would be easier to sustain," Penrod told us. Nikki Beach Today, Nikki Beach has hotels in Greece, Thailand, and Turkey, and will be opening a property in Dubai later this year. According to Penrod, the goal with their hotel division is to ensure they're a good neighbor to those they surround, which is why they're working on features like noise-blocking walls. Facebook/Nikki Beach Resort & Spa Porto Heli Click here to learn more about Nikki Beach Hotels & Resorts » The company also has a lifestyle division (with branding and clothing), a music label, and a lifestyle publication, "Nikki Style Magazine." They also operate a nonprofit charity called Nikki Cares, which partners with charities to host fundraising events for various causes. Facebook/Nikki Beach Ibiza "When I was 12, we were a family of seven children on welfare and I told my mother not to worry because one day we would be rich," Penrod said. Today, his lifestyle brand is recognized around the world.
